channel.title: Fuck Knows Where This Topic Is Supposed To Go
channel.description:
I'm looking for an application that will allow me to set audio devices on a per-program level. I found IndieVolume and the idea behind it was exactly what I wanted, however it just didn't work.
tl;dr need chrome to play on different audio output to everything else

item.title: Fuck Knows Where This Topic Is Supposed To Go
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Changing the default audio device once chrome has launched doesn’t work things like youtube play out of whatever is the CURRENT default playback device, even if it changes mid-output.

MacUpdate.com

ChromeLauncherWithExtraAudio for Mac | MacUpdate

Download, install, or update ChromeLauncherWithExtraAudio for Mac from MacUpdate.

Price: Free

only for mac os

Read full topic
item.source: Fuck Knows Where This Topic Is Supposed To Go

item.title: Fuck Knows Where This Topic Is Supposed To Go
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

The audio system is completely different on vista/7, and IndieVolume doesn’t work with it. I’m not aware of anything like it for the new audio stuff, hence me wondering if its even possible.

EDIT: Well, to be a bit picky, chromium is open source, so go ahead and implement the device selection feature yourself if you wish

Read full topic
item.source: Fuck Knows Where This Topic Is Supposed To Go

item.title: Fuck Knows Where This Topic Is Supposed To Go
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Surely it IS possible, since programs like http://www.indievolume.com/ exist, however this specific one doesn’t work for me.

Read full topic
item.source: Fuck Knows Where This Topic Is Supposed To Go

item.title: Fuck Knows Where This Topic Is Supposed To Go
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Afaik the only way you can do this is by setting one device to default, starting chrome, changing the default device, starting your other apps. The app has to implement this on windows, and chrome doesn’t. Put in a feature request in the chromium bug tracker (there already is one, actually, but add your desire to it)

Read full topic

item.title: Fuck Knows Where This Topic Is Supposed To Go
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

So like, you want Chrome to output to your speakers, but something else to output to headphones or something?

[quote=“DEFET, post:2, topic:415049”]need better example, but it sounds like you’re talking about windows volume mixer.[/quote]That lets you control the volume of different programs, not the output

Read full topic
